July 25th, 2022 Performance Update!
With help from Hordex from Discord, we've rewritten most of the explicit update calls to be deferred to the update handler.
This means that most UI refreshes are now correctly controlled by the "Updates Per Second" setting in the options menu.
High level players who are still experiencing lag can significantly improve performance by reducing this number - this will only decrease how often the screen refreshes, not how often the game updates.
---
Additionally, we have a number of new global stories for all the zones, action segments, and other updates from MrPitt!

July 25th, 2022 • A new guild has opened in Commerceville - Assassins Guild! Kill targets across the world, collect their hearts (why is it always hearts?), and return them to the guild to learn the ways of the assassin
• New Actions: Assassinate: Assassination targets are now available in every zone. Every assassination carries a very heavy reputation penalty (mitigated by assassin skill) and gets harder based on your reputation and number of assassinations completed this loop
• New Skill: Assassin - Improves assassination actions and reduces the difficultly scaling in trials
• New Menu: Totals - Records play metrics including total time played and loops/actions completed
• Balance: Thieves guild actions gold rewards x2
• New Option: Highlight New Actions - Places a border around actions that have not yet been completed on this save. Defaults to on, but can be toggled off in options
• Added max button to Gather Team
• Typo fixes

July 20th, 2022 • Survey Update! Survey is now completed using maps purchased in Beginnersville. Completed maps can be returned to the explorer's guild for extra progress in a random uncompleted area.
• A few minor bugfixes

July 20th, 2022 • Added Quick Travel Menu to better navigate all the zones
• Dark Ritual now only shows speed increases for unlocked zones

July 19th, 2022 • New Option: Stat Colors - Changes stat menu bars to be the same colors used in multipart action bars
• Removed Simple Tooltips Option - It was extra work to maintain on every update / change
• Bugfix: DR was not properly increasing zombie strength
• Balance: Added great feast's bonus to team members and zombies to bring team combat better in line with self combat (this seemed more interesting than just adding a flat x5, but may be changed later)

July 20th, 2022 • Balance: Team combat buffs! Restoration now contributes 4x its level instead of 2x to team member strength
We'll see how this feels, and can revisit and improve leadership, too, if needed
• New Option: Players can now enable a setting to have the game automatically pause when a progress action reaches 100% so they can accrue bonus seconds rather than waste time on a loop making little progress
• Tooltip Updates: Many thanks to MakroCZ from the discord for tireless work on a fix for tooltip placement
• Tooltip Updates: Kallious from the discord has helped clarify a number of unlock conditions and tided up the tidy up action in Valhalla
• Bugfix: Imbue Soul could be started at max buff rank, reseting all progress for no reward

July 19th, 2022 • Bugfix: With thanks to Kallious from the Discord, we've finally fixed the bug sometimes making soulstones go negative on DR/IM/GF
• Bugfix: Added additonal error checks to loading save files to autofix some of the common error states
• Bugfix: Trial of dead was not using updated zombie strength formula
• Bugfix: Imbue Soul was not updating training tooltips until next restart

July 19th, 2022 • New Skill: Leadership - Increases your max follower count by 1 for every 100 levels and increases their contribution to team combat
• New Action (Commerceville): Motivational Seminar - Get advice from the head of a totally-not-an-MLM to learn how to be a better leader
• Balance: Zombie Strength is now increased by Dark Ritual / 100(min 1x, up to 6.66x increase)
• Balance: Fight Jungle Monsters now rewards blood instead of hides. Prepare Buffet is now made of blood instead of hide. Still gross.
Note - We'll have to see how these changes land. It may end up being that now Team Combat is too strong compared to self combat. Also, trials will almost certainly need rebalancing.
• Bugfix: Fight actions were giving exp on segment in addition to completion. Increased combat exp of frost/giants & jungle monsters to compensate

July 16th, 2022 • Change: Added "Max Training" button to bottom of action list that will cap all training actions present on the list. This button only appears after players have completed their first imbue mind to reduce clutter

q_a.a: Hover over "Stats" for how they work. What stats are important depend on what actions you need that uses them.
Short runs are better for the early game, but as your runs get longer and you accrue talent and soulstones, longer runs become more useful.

q_a.q: What should my first goal be?
q_a.a: Start with wandering until you have ways of getting mana back. Then try to find how to get some warrior lessions to give yourself a permanent boost, and then try fighting monsters!

q_a.q: How do skill increases / reductions work?
q_a.a: Increases multiply a reward by (1 + level / 60) ^ .25, so you'll see diminishing returns at higher levels. Reductions multiply a cost by 1 / (1 + level / 100), so you'll never be able to bring a cost completely to zero.

q_a.q: When should I use Dark Ritual?
q_a.a: Many people recommend performing another ritual when the cost is less than 5% of your soulstones. Of course, the choice is up to you and there may be cases where it's better to perform it sooner or later.

stories.story: You're a simple courier, on a long trip to deliver a high priority package. Just as you entered town, you tripped - breaking your glasses - and the package burst open, spilling a strange liquid on you. Immediately, your meager amount of mana started draining rapidly. Right as your mana became empty, you found yourself back in the moment the liquid was absorbed into your skin, with your tiny reserves filled... yet draining just as before. This happened again and again, the world resetting with you, until you decided you had to figure out a way to prolong how long these 'loops' were. Mana crystals are often stored in pottery around town, perhaps you'll start there ...

You reach the end of the dungeon, where a softly glowing orb floats on a pedestal. You've found the dungeon core - for the first level of the dungeon, at least. As you grasp it, the essence dives into you, infusing your very being with the power it holds. It is a small amount of power, but this is a small dungeon. You'll be back to take this power again, knowing with the foreign knowledge implanted that it will stay with you no matter when you are.

You reach the end of the dungeon again, but for the first time the core isn't glowing. It's always been thought that dungeon cores build based on the mana spent around them, but you're beginning to think the essence of it's previous incarnations drains it somehow. It doesn't always happen, but you'll need to put more mana into the world to take the core's benefits out of it. You shrug, accepting yet another oddity of the loops.

After spending most of a loop preparing, you're finally ready to leave Beginnersville. In a way, you're going to miss this town, and the thought of leaving almost brings a tear to your eye - until you realize you'll just be back next loop. Grumbling, you set off, hiking into the forest, but by the time you're ready to make camp, you're in a good mood again. The forest is beautiful, teeming with life, and looks to have boundless places to explore. Best of all, on your way here, you passed several locations that are absolutely saturated with mana - you think you'll check those out first.

It's always nice, after doing the same dull tasks as always, when you reach the forest and get to do something new. Whether you're exploring, hunting, learning something or just sitting by the waterfall, the forest always makes a great backdrop. However, as pleasant as it's been here, it's time to move on, at least for now. It would be a long trip, but luckily, after all your exploring, you know some shortcuts, and before long, Merchanton emerges out of the trees. There's a lot to do here! Maybe one of the guilds can help you with your looping problem! Or maybe there's a book in the library that can lead you to a solution! Or maybe... or maybe... that all sounds like a lot of work, and you have been going through a lot lately. Maybe before any of that, you should find a bar and get a drink.

You have explored the guild options in Merchanton and have maybe made a few guild friends along the way, Time to grab pickaxe and start the climb! Reaching Mt. Olympus takes alot of climbing but during the climb you discover these mana geyser but looks like they can be harvested with a pickaxe. You discover runes scattered around the mountain, maybe deciphering them might be useful and about half way up this mountain you discover a massive cavern with room to take a break climbing and explore it, You met these Friendly Trolls in these caverns however they don't sell snowcones...

You have finally reached the top of Mt. Olympus there is a giant door at the very top, a voice rings out "It is time to face JUDGEMENT of the GODS, HAHAHAHA. Hope you are prepared for judgement!" After waiting for what feels like hours the voice rings out "You may PASS!". You enter the wonderful place called Valhalla, you have a tourist show you around and even looks like a charity is happening. After exploring you realize also can join charm school or wizard college, become a citizen, and even fight with the Valkyries. Home of the gods couldn't be any better.

The voice rings "You Shall Not PASS!". You feel like you are being lifted and are chucked off Mt. Olymupus and into the shadow realm. The shadow realm opens up and you hit the floor luckily with only a scratch, after a few hours you finally can get up and realize that this isn't beginnersville anymore. After closer inspection of the ruins nearby you realize these ruins is alot more twisted and strange that you thought they were gonna be. You notice these strange pylons and seak to destroy them and a few minutes later you look and finally notice the giant spire in front of you!

Before you leave Startington you realize you don't have the supplies you got in Beginnersville, but lucky for you Startington sells another supply set but rumor has it that the shopkeeper is kinda deaf so your haggles won't work on them. You get your supplies and you set off down the trail, reminds you of the forest. You walk untill you see a jungle up ahead with ruins all around, probly best to start exploring them.

You have made the Loop Potion after learning alchemistry and grabbing herbs from the forest, you take a bit to brew the concoction and after it boils a bit and the herbs soak into a nearby mana geyser then you pour it into a bottle. After a glance you have no doubts that it is the think you spilled back in beginnersville, but you have no idea what to do with it now.

After you explore the ruins you notice the exit out of here is gonna be blocked of soon might have to beat the loop fast enough. You just beat the exit just barely and notice that there is another small city, time to pay someone to show you around town! The guide shows you the explorers guild and explains that they have many perks for joining, nifty! The guide also takes you down a alley way and shows you that you can join the Thieves Guild to make a little bit of cash. After the guide is done showing you around town he explains that they are with the tax collectors and you probly should be going now, quickly you make it to the Bank and you notice a hooded figure might be worth checking what they do.

After you take a heafty loan from the bank you can now own Commerceville and leave while you still can, after you walk down the road you realize you can move the stones from the Jungle and move them to build a great tower. After you build the great tower you realize you can't reach Valhalla unless you can clear trial of the gods to prove worthy of entering again. After finally clearing the trial of the gods, the voice speaks "The 7 gods of this land protect this world, if you want to enter Valhalla you can defeat us to be worth of the throne." After a long battle the last god goes down and you gain the power of all 7 gods, with great power you can end the time loop now and forever!

You've done it! You've bested the gods themselves and restored time to its rightful flow. You can stop looping at any moment. But, then again, you could keep going. There's always time later... Thanks for playing my fan mod of Idle Loops! Big shout-out to the wonderful Stop_Sign for creating this amazing game and Omsi for all the Omsi version. You both have inspired me more than you can imagine. Hope everyone had fun! <3
--Lloyd

alchemy.desc: Brewing potions is hard work! It's a good thing you found a teacher.
alchemy.desc2: The Magic teacher in Beginnersville adores alchemists. +1% Magic exp gain from the Mage Lessons action (rounded down) per level.

dark.desc: Use various dark arts to help you harvest mana.

Multiply the mana gain from Smash Pots and Wild Mana by (1 + level / 60) ^ 0.25 (rounded down).

crafting.label: Crafting
crafting.desc: The skill of using your hands and creativity when doing physical work.

chronomancy.label: Chronomancy
chronomancy.desc: Harness the magic of time to, well, speed up time.

Actions in all zones are (1 + level / 60) ^ 0.25 times faster.

x speed.

pyromancy.label: Pyromancy
pyromancy.desc: Fireball, Firebolt, Fire Shield, Burning Rays, just a veritable assortment of flaming fun!
pyromancy.desc2: Increases self combat with 5x the efficiency of the combat skill.

restoration.label: Restoration
restoration.desc: From healing cantrips to mass resurrection, you'll be sure to make good use of these spells.
restoration.desc2: Increases team combat with 4x the efficiency of the combat skill and improves the Heal the Sick action.

leadership.desc: You're ready to start your own cult!
leadership.desc2:

Currently granting

dark_ritual.label: Dark Ritual
dark_ritual.desc: The witch appreciates your dedication to the dark arts. +1% to Dark Magic exp gain from the Dark Magic action (rounded down) per ritual.

imbue_mind.label: Imbue Mind
imbue_mind.desc:
Using power from soulstones, you can increase your mental prowess.
Increases the max amount of times you can do each training action by 1 per level and improves some actions.

imbue_body.label: Imbue Body
imbue_body.desc:
By sacrificing your accumulated talent, you can permanently improve yourself.
At the start of a new loop, all stats begin at Imbue Body level.

great_feast.label: Great Feast
great_feast.desc:
That feast was so filling that it manages to keep you well satiated through your loops! That's some impressive magic.
Self and Team Combat are increased by 5% per level. (rounded down)

aspirant.label: Aspirant
aspirant.desc:
Reaching new heights in the spire fills your mind and soul with vigor and clarity.
Talent Exp gain is increased by 1% per level.

heroism.label: Heroism
heroism.desc:
Completing the trial fills you with determination.
Combat, Pyromancy, and Restoration Skill Exp gain increased by 2% per level.

imbue_soul.label: Imbue Soul
imbue_soul.desc:
(Incomplete) Sacrifice everything for the ultimate power.
Increases the exp multiplier of training actions by 100% and raises all action speeds by 50% per level additively.

tooltip.no_reset_on_restart:
Buffs last through resets.
You can click on the right hand number to edit it and adjust the cap for that buff. (buff actions will automatically fail and not spend soulstones past your set cap)

town0.name: Beginnersville
town0.desc: Rats in basements, aggressive solo boars, bouncing slimes, and strangers that love exposition are some of the the common things you'll see around Beginnersville. Some people are missing helmets or shoes, and the fanciest sword around is still made out of iron. You got lucky with decent towns to start looping at. If only there weren't so many rules not letting you do dangerous things, it'd be perfect.

town1.name: Forest Path
town1.desc: A forever green forest. You feel mana flowing around, but hiding in the dark, you sense an evil presence...

town2.name: Merchanton
town2.desc: Merchanton! A modest town bustling with activity. You can find many attractions here, such as the library, the adventuring guild, the crafting guild, and the bazaar. Oh, and did I mention there's loads of suckers to swindle?

town3.name: Mt. Olympus
town3.desc: You could have taken that path to the other town, but no! You just had to go to Mt. Olympus, didn't you. But anyways, while you're here, thanks to being neither a canine nor old, you can learn a few new tricks. And kill some innocent trolls while you're at it.

town4.name: Valhalla
town4.desc: A sprawling and jolly city filled with all manner of nice things. Vikings, beer, angels, beer, blah blah blah, and beer! You can spend your time in the great hall, or in the outskirts of the city. Either way, you'll surely have a great time.

town5.name: Startington
town5.desc: A once familiar place, now crawling with shadows and ominous feelings of wasted sick days. There stands a large pillar of gloomy purple light in the center of it all, eminating from a spire surrounded by black clouds. It's emitting 10 weak beams of purple light to various points around the town, and appears to be casting all the shadows. Maybe you should check those spots out.

town6.name: Jungle Path
town6.desc: A twisting jungle that seems determined to swallow you in its depths.

town7.name: Commerceville
town7.desc: Everyone here is looking to make a buck.

town8.name: Valley of Olympus
town8.desc: A mountain shaped hole in the groud.

calculated_shattering.name: Calculated Shattering
calculated_shattering.desc:
Practicing your shattering technique to get through all these pots as quickly as possible seems rather productive.
Reduces the mana cost of by 1 per level.

no_frill_frames.name: No-frill Frames
no_frill_frames.desc:
If you dedicate a bit of time to perusing for glasses, you can find some cheaper frames. And considering you won't be using them for too long until everything starts over again, you figure it's a good idea to skimp.
Reduces the gold cost of by 1 per level.

Gained exp is proportional too.
Stat/Talent exp is gained every tick.
Skill exp is gained upon action completion unless otherwise specified.
Actions will target unchecked objects before known lootable objects.

Shows stat gain affecting speed.
Updates every completed action.
Accurate at end of run.
Effective time:
0
tooltip.add_action_top: Add action to top of list
tooltip.higher_done_percent_benefic: You can find more stuff with higher %.

Drag and drop the actions to re-arrange them.
The next list becomes the current list every restart.
One second = 50 mana.
Minimum 1 tick per action.

survey.label: Survey
survey.tooltip:
The explorers guild has taught you to find what most would miss.
Gives progress equal to the square root of average survey progress across all zones.
Cannot re-survey completed zones.
Requires a map for each action.
Currently granting
exp per action.
survey.story_1: 20% World Survey:⮀ You decide it is time to discover the world. One of the explorers decided to come on the journey around the world their name is Dora, the journey is long but so worth.
survey.story_2: 40% World Survey:⮀ Crazy how discovering the world over again is shedding a new light on the world, new items you never seen have just been out of place.
survey.story_3: 60% World Survey:⮀ Nobody is stopping you from exploring more and more, it feels nice. At least the view is spectacular!
survey.story_4: 80% World Survey:⮀ You are almost done with your trip and you have enjoyed every second of it. You wish the explorer's guild has found more locations to visit, but they couldn't find anything new.
survey.story_5: 100% World Survey:⮀ your last exploration had the strangest encounter of them all. just as you finished surveying the area, a fox appeared out of nowhere and swiped your remaining maps!

assassin.label: Assassinate
assassin.tooltip:
Discreetly kill your mark in this town. The more well-known you are, for either good or evil, the harder pulling this off will be...
Gives progress equal to (Sqrt(Practical) + Thievery + Assassin) * Stat/1000 * Sqrt(Completions/100) / Abs(reputation) / hearts.
Rewards a heart.

assassinz0.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Beginnersville:⮀ His name was Ethan, you met him on your fifteenth loop. Always seemed to be getting into some sort of trouble. You ambush him as he strolls down an alley and carve out his heart before he knows what happened. He'll be fine next loop, you tell yourself.

assassinz1.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Forest Path:⮀ How was there more people in the forest besides the hermit and the witch? who knows, all that matters is you killed someone and left with the heart.

assassinz2.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Merchanton:⮀ You walked into the casino, looked around to check for cameras and killed someone in the storage room. You got the heart and left quickly before being spotted.

assassinz3.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Mt. Olympus:⮀ You climbed the Mountain and killed one of the yeti's for their heart, what they get for not selling snowcones.

assassinz4.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Valhalla:⮀ Gods are looking all around but someone not paying tax on your property comes first, you kill them and grab the heart and quickly leave.

assassinz5.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Startington:⮀ Everyone here is almost close to being dead so should be quick and easy. You get the heart so quick and moved on.

assassinz6.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Jungle Path:⮀ Survivers are lost so you can use that to your advantage, 1 quick kill later and you can move on. Don't forget the heart!

assassinz7.story_1: 1 Assassinated in Commerenceville:⮀ Last task on the list and there are a ton of corrupted people here, plus the assassnation guild is here to collect all the hearts you gotten.

ruinsZ1.label: Ruins
ruinsZ1.tooltip: As you've explored, you've found a number of old ruins scattered around. It's probably worth your time to explore them.
ruinsZ1.story_1: 10% delved:⮀ You decide to explore the ruins in the Forest and notice some weird looking rocks, wonder what they do.
ruinsZ1.story_2: 50% delved:⮀ After investgating these weird looking rocks you notice they are cubical and are heavy, looks like they are dusty from the time they have been sitting here.
ruinsZ1.story_3: 100% delved:⮀ You have discover everything in these ruins, and notice that there are so many cubical stones lying everywhere like a massive battle happend.

ruinsZ3.label: Ruins
ruinsZ3.tooltip: As you've explored, you've found a number of old ruins scattered around. It's probably worth your time to explore them.
ruinsZ3.story_1: 10% delved:⮀ You decide to explore the ruins in the Mt. Olympus and notice the same cubical rocks, wonder what they do.
ruinsZ3.story_2: 50% delved:⮀ There is a stone with some writing, with your high intellegent you might be able to read this strange language.
ruinsZ3.story_3: 100% delved:⮀ After looking around the ruins it looks like there is a weapon rusted of some sort that looks like one of the Valkeries used, wonder what really happened.

ruinsZ5.label: Ruins
ruinsZ5.tooltip: As you've explored, you've found a number of old ruins scattered around. It's probably worth your time to explore them.
ruinsZ5.story_1: 10% delved:⮀ You decide to explore the ruins in the Startington and and notice the same dusty cubical rocks, wonder what they do.
ruinsZ5.story_2: 50% delved:⮀ After deciphering the text on this stone block, You can see some of the text since the rest has corroded over time.
ruinsZ5.story_3: 100% delved:⮀ The text explains that the Valkeries started a war that lasted for a month, after a month of fighting they finally declared peace. Who did they fight against???

ruinsZ6.label: Ruins
ruinsZ6.tooltip: As you've explored, you've found a number of old ruins scattered around. It's probably worth your time to explore them.
ruinsZ6.story_1: 10% delved:⮀ You decide to explore the ruins in the Jungle Path and and notice the same dusty and heavy cubical rocks, wonder what they do.
ruinsZ6.story_2: 50% delved:⮀ You notice a god weapon on the floor in the middle of this ruins, almost like they left this here on purpose.
ruinsZ6.story_3: 100% delved:⮀ Looking at the weapon has a small text that says, war has ended and this weapon is layed to rest. Did the gods fight the Valkeries???

haulZ1.label: Haul
haulZ1.tooltip:
You find a strange stones that resists change from the loop. When you move them, they remain in the new location the next time you return. Most of the rocks are just ordinary though. It'll take a while to find the interesting ones.
You're sure you can use them for something. They're too heavy to move more than one at a time though.
One in every thousand Stones is temporal.
haulZ1.story_1: First Temporal Stone Found:⮀ After digging thru the cubical stones, you notice a light blue light glowing with a swirl pattern on the sides of the rock and they are slightly easier to pick up but still weigh a ton.
haulZ1.story_2: Moved 100 Temporal Stones:⮀ Slowly you pick up the stones one by one and move them to Valley of Olympus. Make sure to use your legs when lifting!
haulZ1.story_3: Moved 250 Temporal Stones:⮀ Finally all the stones have been moved from the Forest Path to Valley of Olympus.

map.label: Purchase Map
map.tooltip:
The explorer's guild has taught you how to use cartographer's kits to map where you're going. This will let you keep track of things better and find all sorts of new secrets.
There's a shop here in Beginnersville that will sell them for just
map.story_1: Bought a Map:⮀ "You buy the map and upon seeing the map, you exclaim that the earth appears to be flat, and someone at the guild says "that's because it's a flat drawing!"; but on the bright side you can explore extra areas in other locations!"

wander.label: Wander
wander.tooltip: Explore the town, look for hidden areas and treasures.
wander.story_1: 20% Explored:⮀ You know the general layout of the small village now, you don't get lost walking from one side to another!
wander.story_2: 40% Explored:⮀ You're starting to really know your way around, you can almost figure your way around without following a set path!
wander.story_3: 60% Explored:⮀ You've tread all the main roads and you avail yourself to the unkempt side paths and well worn paths. If you let yourself into some houses along the way, well, no one needs to know, do they?
wander.story_4: 80% Explored:⮀ You've decided to explore the houses now that you've trod every single feasible path in this small village. Man, the stuff people keep around.
wander.story_5: 100% Explored:⮀ You've been everywhere, there is absolutely nowhere in this town you haven't been. You've been in every cellar, under every bed, and in every closet. You've pried all the floorboards, and just in general, been into everything. Except the houses with locks, those dastardly locks.

smash_pots.label: Smash Pots
smash_pots.tooltip:
They're just sitting there, unbroken, full of potential.
Pots with mana in them have
smash_pots.story_1: 50 Pots with mana:⮀ You've smashed every single pot in this village, and have figured out all the pots that contain any trace of mana. Having to break them all physically was time consuming, and your skills at absorbing the mana weren't the best. There must be more efficient ways of doing it.
smash_pots.story_2: 75 Pots with mana:⮀ Is the pot over here, or is it over there? Space can be such a fickle thing sometimes. Maybe it's both! There, now there's another pot to loot.

pick_locks.label: Pick Locks
pick_locks.tooltip:
Don't worry; they won't remember.
Houses with valuables in them have
pick_locks.tooltip2:
gold.
Every 10 houses have gold.
Unlocked at 20% Explored.
pick_locks.story_1: House checked:⮀ You manage to pick a lock that was in disrepair and opened the door, only to walk into the home's inhabitant. Good thing the loop ended not soon after. You're gonna have to figure out which houses are worth hitting. Some money wouldn't go astray.
pick_locks.story_2: 50 Houses known:⮀ You really should look at hitting those locked houses around, who knows what goodies you'll manage to scrounge up.
pick_locks.story_3: 10 Houses with loot:⮀ You've figured out which houses are uninhabited and have enough gold for it to be worth your time. As they say, time is mana!
pick_locks.story_4: 25 Houses with loot in a loop:⮀ Some would say that entering a house from the back door instead of the front doesn't change what you find inside. Some people aren't masters of spatiomancy.

buy_glasses.label: Buy Glasses
buy_glasses.tooltip:
That's not fair. There was time now. There was all the time I needed.
Now you have to get new glasses again for 10 gold!
Causes Wander to be 4x as effective for the rest of the loop.
Affects any action with the glasses icon
Can only have 1 Buy Glasses action.
Unlocked at 20% explored.
buy_glasses.story_1: Glasses bought:⮀ The world snaps into sharp focus as you put them on and you gawk a little as details that had slipped your eyes previously stood out in sharp contrast. You're a little gobsmacked at how much of a difference they make.

found_glasses.label: Found Glasses
found_glasses.tooltip:
You could have sworn you had a spare pair of glasses somewhere. Now you've explored to the ends of the world. Every nook or cranny has revealed to you their secrets. And you've found them - in the last place anyone would ever think to look. On top of your head.
You now start all loops with glasses.
found_glasses.story_1: Found Glasses:⮀ Wait did you have your glasses above your head and you still bought another one??? Glad you had high enough chrisma skill to pull that off.

buy_mana_z1.label: Buy Mana
buy_mana_z1.tooltip2:
mana. Buys all the mana you can.
Unlocked at 20% Explored.
buy_mana_z1.story_1: Bought Mana:⮀ A mana salesman?! For most people, this would only be a convenience, but given your current situation, this might be the most valuable thing you ever could have found.

buy_mana_challenge.label: Buy Mana
buy_mana_challenge.tooltip2:
mana. Buys all the mana you can.
The merchant only has 7500 mana to sell, though.
Unlocked at 20% Explored.
buy_mana_challenge.story_1: Bought Mana:⮀ You walk up to the mana stand ready to throw your money at the man behind the counter, but before you can get a word out, he interrupts you, saying "I'm sure you understand my reasonable prices, yes? Times are hard during this drought - my colleagues are all out of stock, and my own supplies are down to just 7500 mana." His prices are ridiculous, but you pay them with gritted teeth, having no other option.
buy_mana_challenge.story_2: 7500 Mana Bought:⮀ After you buy everything the man has for sale, he immediately states that he's out of stock and proceeds to slam the stall window on you. As he disappears, you spot a shadow of fear cross his face. He must have to deal with a lot of angry would-be customers these days.

meet_people.label: Meet People
meet_people.tooltip:
They won't let you get away with a simple chat.
Unlocked at 22% Explored.
meet_people.story_1: 1% People Met:⮀ You stand there, a little stumped at the situation you’ve gotten yourself into, when a young lass asks you about your day so far.
meet_people.story_2: 20% People Met:⮀ The people here are generally nice enough, if a bit brusque at times. Some people have small tasks that they're happy to pay for.
meet_people.story_3: 40% People Met:⮀ There are a surprising amount of people in the village. You didn’t catch that when you were looking around.
meet_people.story_4: 60% People Met:⮀ It almost seems that most people have something they want done, the real problem is figuring out whats worth your time.
meet_people.story_5: 80% People Met:⮀ Having met such a large portion of the people in this village, you almost feel guilty about stealing from them. Almost.
meet_people.story_6: 100% People Met:⮀ You've spoken to everyone. Every child, adult, teen, animal and plant in this village. Everyone, and everything.

train_strength.label: Train Strength
train_strength.tooltip:
Build up those muscles. Again.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
Unlocked at 5% People Met.
train_strength.story_1: Strength trained:⮀ You lift the oak barrel filled with water, holding it while you squat again and again. The barrel rests upon your back as you do push up after push up. It's a trusty companion in your quest to regain your muscle.
train_strength.story_2: 100 Strength talent:⮀ Your body adapts faster and faster to the strains you put upon it. You know exactly how far to push it and can tell almost instinctively when to stop.
train_strength.story_3: 1,000 Strength talent:⮀ Your body seems to build itself up faster and faster each time you break it down. You can practically feel your mana purr in satisfaction as it rebuilds your body to be stronger and stronger.
train_strength.story_4: 10,000 Strength talent:⮀ You have gotten so strong, you can destroy a pot with a well-aimed flick of the fingers, and crush monsters in your grip. Yet you feel like you can still push even further beyond those limits, and train like no other!
train_strength.story_5: 100,000 Strength talents:⮀ One by one you run out of measurable limits to your strength. Armor shatters before your fist and stone yields like wet clay to your fingers. You yearn to push your limits even more. Maybe if you sought out a god for an arm-wrestling match?

short_quest.label: Short Quest
short_quest.tooltip:
Be a hero! ...If the reward is good and it doesn't take too long.
Short Quests with loot give
short_quest.tooltip2:
gold as a reward.
Every 5 Short Quests have loot.
Unlocked at 5% People Met.
short_quest.story_1: Short Quest finished:⮀ You help an elderly woman get her cat down from atop her house, she rewards you handsomely for your efforts.
short_quest.story_2: 20 Short Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ You’ve helped everyone who’s been willing to take you on, and the gold from your work jingles beautifully in your pockets. The satisfaction of a job well done fills you with pride.
short_quest.story_3: 50 Short Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ You've gotten so familiar with residents daily routines and needs that you can finish chores for them before they ever think to ask for help. The only problem is how much it unnerves people to see somebody just a bit too helpful...

investigate.label: Investigate
investigate.tooltip:
You've been hearing some rumors...
Unlocked at 25% People Met.
investigate.story_1: 20% Investigated:⮀ You catch some snippets of truly interesting gossip. Apparently a Mage and Warrior duo had stopped in and were sticking around for a little while.
investigate.story_2: 40% Investigated:⮀ People are really helpful when you help them, you're almost starting to get a reputation as a busybody around here, but it's offset in that you actually do help people.
investigate.story_3: 60% Investigated:⮀ People are generally more willing to open up if you seem like you know things, and you do know things, as you've been around here awhile now.
investigate.story_4: 80% Investigated:⮀ The villagers are all to happy to share some stories with you at this point, it doesn't hurt that you know a little about most people now and are more than willing to strike up a conversation.
investigate.story_5: 100% Investigated:⮀ You've done it, spoken to everyone in this village. Spent a loop or more on each of them, actually. You know what needs to be done, and at this point you can just go straight there. You can also engineer a situation in which the more stubborn ones will offer you a quest.

long_quest.label: Long Quest
long_quest.tooltip:
Be a more impressive hero! ...As long as someone is watching.
Long Quests with loot give
long_quest.tooltip2:
gold and 1 reputation as a reward.
Every 5 Long Quests have loot.
Unlocked at 10% Investigated.
long_quest.story_1: Long Quest finished:⮀ You cleared out a cellar of rats; there were at least sixty of the blighters. You were rewarded handsomely, and you got a small reputation boost to boot.
long_quest.story_2: 10 Long Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ You’ve cleared out cellars, helped build a house, collected flowers for dyes, worked in the bakery, taken out trash, and helped a seamstress finish a gift for her husband. Your reputation is spreading as the helpful courier. Everyone is at the very least willing to listen to you.
long_quest.story_3: 25 Long Quests with loot in a loop:⮀ The town has nothing left for you to do at this point and suggest that maybe you might find more work somewhere else. They appreciate everything you did, and many of the townsfolk are eager to put in a good word for you.

throw_party.label: Throw Party
throw_party.tooltip:
Take a break and socialize.
Gives people met progress equivalent to 16 Meet People actions.
Costs 2 reputation.
Unlocked at 30% Investigated.
throw_party.story_1: Party thrown:⮀ You announce that its your birthday and you want to throw a party. You commandeer the village square and the people necessary to make it happen. You don't have the gold but people aren't quite able to say no. You promise you'll pay it off with the money from this current job.
throw_party.story_2: 10 Party thrown in a loop:⮀ You throw a massive celebration that lasts the entire day. The whole town is invited, and since you're offering free food, most of them even show up! There are multiple parades as well as a dunk tank, the latter of which doesn't come cheap, but you don't care. You told them you'll pay it off "later", and since you've done such a massive amount for the town today, they didn't have much grounds to refuse you.

warrior_lessons.label: Warrior Lessons
warrior_lessons.tooltip:
Learning to fight is probably important; you have a long journey ahead of you.
Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
Unlocked at 20% Investigated.
warrior_lessons.story_1: 1 Combat:⮀ You manage to track down the warrior that was staying in town, and are greeted by a small woman holding a sword almost as tall as her. She introduces herself as "Iron" and smiles politely. Her pleasant demeanour doesn't stop her from thoroughly trouncing you.
warrior_lessons.story_2: 100 Combat:⮀ You manage to give Iron a run for her money, but she still manages to eek out a victory. She is, however, noticeably worn out afterwards.
warrior_lessons.story_3: 200 Combat:⮀ You push Iron to the brink of defeat, and then she starts fighting dirty.
warrior_lessons.story_4: 250 Combat:⮀ All your experience fighting Iron finally pays off when you manage to defeat her! You feel really proud of yourself, right up until she smacks your head with the flat of her sword and demands a rematch.
warrior_lessons.story_5: 1,000 Combat:⮀ You decide to honor the rematch and fight with Iron once more, the duel lasts for 2 weeks and you both end up in a draw. She is suprised how far you have come with your training, she tells you that when she was a kid she had to pick up a weapon to help protect the town. She states that monsters would enter town and attack so training was the only way to become who she is today.

mage_lessons.label: Mage Lessons
mage_lessons.tooltip:
The mystic got you into this mess, maybe it can help you get out of it.
Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
Unlocked at 20% Investigated.
mage_lessons.story_1: 1 Magic:⮀ You approach a burly man dressed in flowing robes, and ask if he would be willing to teach you some magic. The man agrees to teach you some basic cantrips if you help him out with menial tasks. He introduces himself as Warrick.
mage_lessons.story_2: 100 Magic:⮀ Warrick compliments you on your ability to wield mana, and is happy to share some more dangerous cantrips with your promise to not use it for ill. He refuses to teach you about alchemy.
mage_lessons.story_3: 200 Magic:⮀ Warrick is suspicious about your proficiency with mana for someone he's just run into in the wild, but is still more than willing to humor you. If he throws appraising glances at you every now and then, you pay them no mind.
mage_lessons.story_4: 250 Magic:⮀ You and Warrick duel, your lessons from that point on are finding an out of the way location and duking it out with magic. Warrick seems appreciative about the exertion.
mage_lessons.story_5: 10 Alchemy:⮀ You offer to help him with his alchemy work and he immdiately seems to develop a soft spot for you, talking about herbs and their effects when combined with eachother and how they build together to create mystical potions. The man's passionate, that's for sure.
mage_lessons.story_6: 50 Alchemy:⮀ You offer Warrick some alchemy techniques that he's never heard of in exchange for some more magic techniques and lessons. He agrees readily.
mage_lessons.story_7: 100 Alchemy:⮀ You offer to teach Warrick about alchemy if he teaches you about the branches of magic you have little grounding in. The man himself is a genius and has much to teach. He gives it his all, tempted by the secrets of Alchemy.

heal_the_sick.label: Heal The Sick
heal_the_sick.tooltip:
You won't be able to heal them all, but they'll be thankful for doing what you can.
Healing is always 3 parts, each with a main stat - Diagnose (Per), Treat (Int), Inform (Cha).
Gives (magic skill) * max(restoration skill/50, 1) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires a reputation of 1 or above.
Unlocked at 12 Magic skill.
Gives 3 reputation upon patient completion.
heal_the_sick.story_1: Patient healed:⮀ You're allowed in to see the patients and begin healing. It's excellent practice and everyone you heal, be it from broken bones to small scrapes is extraordinarily thankful for your help.
heal_the_sick.story_2: 10 Patients healed in a loop:⮀ Your reputation is absolutely sterling, you've basically cleared out the entire healing home and the nurses and healers are more than thankful for your help.
heal_the_sick.story_3: 100 Patients healed:⮀ You've healed some of these townsfolk so many times, you don't actually need to speak to them or examine them to find out what's wrong. You go through the same steps anyways, because good bedside manners are an integral part of earning respect as a healer.
heal_the_sick.story_4: 1000 Patients healed:⮀ You never went to medical school, but you've healed so many people that you're pretty much an expert now. Nothing can stop you, nothing can stump you, nothing can even slow you down! ...Except when they bring in a patient you haven't seen before. When that happens, it usually takes you a while to figure out what their problem is.
heal_the_sick.story_5: Failed Action:⮀ You're turned away at the door, the small healers home stating that they can't trust you to not poison the people inside or make the situation worse.
heal_the_sick.story_6: 50 Restoration:⮀ As good as you were at healing already, you think you've gotten good enough at restoration magic that it can help you heal people even faster! Healing really is a fulfilling job, especially now that you're actually competent at it - maybe you'll keep doing it once you're out of the loops.

fight_monsters.label: Fight Monsters
fight_monsters.tooltip:
Slowly, you're figuring out their patterns.
Fighting rotates between 3 types of battles, each with a main stat - Quick (Spd), Defensive (Str), Aggressive (Con).
Gives (self combat) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times completed / 100) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
Unlocked at 10 Combat skill.
Gives 20 gold per fight segment completion.

fight_monsters.story_1: Monster killed:⮀ It's all so new, the way they respond and attack, you're not ashamed to admit that you almost got brained by a deer. Either way, their hides and rendered components will sell well.
fight_monsters.story_2: 100 Monsters killed:⮀ You thought it would take longer to learn, but these monsters are pretty straightforward. Pay attention to their body language and they'll all but announce their next attack.
fight_monsters.story_3: 500 Monsters killed:⮀ Duck, sidestep, stab, and another monster goes down. You wipe some sweat off your brow and let the adrenaline fade. They always fall for that trick.
fight_monsters.story_4: 1,000 Monsters killed:⮀ Three monsters charge you at once. You lunge at the last second, scoring a blow against one while letting the other two crash into each other. By the time they're ready for a second attack, you'll be done with your current foe.
fight_monsters.story_5: 5,000 Monsters killed:⮀ If a herd's too big to fight, you pick off a few of them from ambush while the rest aren't looking. Let a few more fall into carefully-placed traps and then you take to the field yourself and finish the rest off.
fight_monsters.story_6: 10,000 Monsters killed:⮀ You only move the barest amount necessary to avoid getting hit. At this point you know all their movements like the back of your hand, and there's always a gap in their attack pattern. You're glad they're too dumb to coordinate with each other.
fight_monsters.story_7: 20,000 Monsters killed:⮀ The most efficient way to dodge, and the most efficient way to kill. You don't need ambushes anymore, you can wade into battle against any number of monsters and kill them all one after another, always inches away from death but never making a single misstep.

small_dungeon.label: Small Dungeon
small_dungeon.tooltip:
There are small changes each time; it's harder to get used to. The soulstones at the end last through loops, but they're not always in the dungeon... Strange.
The dungeon requires different skills at different points.
One action can clear multiple floors if your stats are high enough.
Gives (magic + self combat) * (1 + main stat / 100) * sqrt(1 + times floor completed / 200) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
Requires a reputation of 2 or above.
Gives 1 soulstone per completion - hover over Looted for info.
small_dungeon.completed_tooltip:
Each soulstone improves a random stat's exp gain by (1+(soulstones)^.8/30).
Each floor has
x
soulstone that, when received, you lose 2% chance on the current drop chance on every successful soulstone recieved.
Chance to receive a soulstone recovers per floor at 0.00001% per mana.
Each soulstone improves a random stat's exp gain by (1+(soulstones)^.8/30).
Each floor has a soulstone that, when received, reduces the chance you'll get the next one by 2%.
Chance to receive a soulstone recovers per floor at 0.00001% per mana.
small_dungeon.story_1: Small dungeon attempted:⮀ The cavernous entrance to the villages dungeon greets you. It's dark and looming, with rocks forming jagged fangs. It's the most imposing thing you've found in this town so far.
small_dungeon.story_2: 1,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ You know your way around the dungeon like no one else, almost as if you've explored every nook and cranny. You have.
small_dungeon.story_3: 5,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ The dungeon poses less and less of a threat to you each time you conquer it, the soulstones growing your power by small amounts now that you've accumulated so many of them.
small_dungeon.story_4: 10,000 Dungeon floors looted:⮀ The dungeon is a joke to you, if you could teleport you'd simply jump straight to them, the dungeon in your mind has been reduced to how short it is to get from one soulstone to the next. If you have to destroy a couple walls, so be it.
small_dungeon.story_5: 6 Floors cleared in a loop:⮀ You reach the actual end of the dungeon, the dungeon core glows an angry red as if irritated that you're at this floor at all. Regardless, you take your soulstone and leave, the dungeon core's red glow following you the whole time.

buy_supplies.label: Buy Supplies
buy_supplies.tooltip:
Prepare to move on.
Costs
gold.
You only need one set of supplies.
buy_supplies.story_1: Supplies bought:⮀ A tent, enough rations to last for a month, portable cooking equipment and other assorted paraphernalia for your trip. The tent is durable and the rations don't taste bland and lifeless. It was probably worth the 300 gold asking price. Good thing you knew how to haggle.
buy_supplies.story_2: Supplies bought without haggling:⮀ How luxurious! You had the gold to just throw it away now, even though the mana would've been more beneficial in the long run, not having to haggle once in awhile was surprisingly nice. Truly, you have grown luxuriant.

haggle.label: Haggle
haggle.tooltip:
They won't like you as much, but hey - you're leaving.
Costs 1 reputation to reduce the price of supplies by 20.
Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
haggle.story_1: Haggle:⮀ The shopkeep has some of the supplies you need, but they are of inferior quality and you're not paying his asking price for them, at least that's what you tell him. You argue, grumble, make sharp comments and are just in general unpleasant to one another.
haggle.story_2: 15 Haggles in a loop:⮀ The shopkeep basically throws you out the store shouting and cursing vociferously at you. You ears ring slightly at the barrage.
haggle.story_3: 16 Haggles in a loop:⮀ At this point, it served no purpose, you were doing this solely for the fun of it. No matter how much you haggled, the merchant wasn't going to pay you to take the supplies. That was just wishful thinking. Although, losing the reputation you had accrued could be useful in the long run...

start_journey.label: Start Journey
start_journey.tooltip:
Follow the trail to end up at the next town. You need to keep moving until you can learn how to shut these loops off.
Costs 1 supplies. Finish once to unlock Forest Path's actions, then finish this in order to use Forest Path's actions.
Unlocked at a combined Combat and Magic skill of 35.
start_journey.story_1: Traveled to the second zone:⮀ You leave town, heading towards the forest that stood between the village and Merchanton. You've exhausted every option in Beginnersville, and there's nothing here that will stop the loops. It's time to look for solutions elsewhere.

hitch_ride.label: Hitch Ride
hitch_ride.tooltip:
The explorers guild has a contract with various caravaans for transport around the world. They have taught you the secret handsigns to gain passage. And this one just happens to have some spare mana to share on the journey!
Travels to Merchanton.
hitch_ride.story_1: Hitched a Ride:⮀ The Explores guild wagon is waiting on the edge of town, you give them the signel and they give you a lift. The wagon driver says "Welcome aboard fellow guild member, we are headed to merchanton to get a few drinks. Wouldn't mind giving you a lift." The wagon members are singing all the way to merchanton and the wagon driver says "We have arrived in Merchanton! I wish you the best of luck on your journey!" You thank the driver and depart from the wagon.

open_rift.label: Open Rift
open_rift.tooltip:
Using your vast knowledge of the dark arts, you can open a rift into the shadow realm to send you straight to Startington.
Unfortunately, it doesn't seem like you can fit any supplies through the rift.
Unlocked at 300 Dark Magic and 100 Spatiomancy.
open_rift.story_1: Opening the Rift:⮀ After speaking with the Witch she gives you a spell to open a rift of some sort. You use your magic and a small rift opens in front of you, luckily you arn't getting thrown into it this time. You take a step in the rift and you have entered Startington!

explore_forest.label: Explore Forest
explore_forest.tooltip:
What a pleasant area.
2x progress with glasses.
explore_forest.story_1: 1% Forest explored:⮀ You look at the side of the path from your little campsite, and are struck with a sense of wanderlust. You leave your camp to explore. Not too far from your campsite you find a tiny glade practically overflowing with mana.
explore_forest.story_2: 10% Forest explored:⮀ The sense of wanderlust hasn't faded but you've definitely discovered the darker side of this forest. You continue to find tiny glades filled with mana throughout the forest.
explore_forest.story_3: 20% Forest explored:⮀ You were exploring the forest when you found what looked like game trails but was actually a footpath worn into the ground, you decided to follow it.
explore_forest.story_4: 40% Forest explored:⮀ You continue exploring the forest, and you've discovered something odd about it. One side of the main path is... calm you suppose, peaceful even. Welcoming. The other makes you feel ill at ease, as if there are unseen eyes constantly on you. One side is light and airy, the other dark and gloomy.
explore_forest.story_5: 50% Forest explored:⮀ You found flowers in the forest, growing in the almost pitch black beneath the thick canopy on the gloomy side of the forest. Yet the flowers grow. There's a desire to follow them, almost as if they're saying, "Follow Me!"
explore_forest.story_6: 60% Forest explored:⮀ You continue searching around the forest, finding tracks and trails, boltholes and hollowed out tree trunks. Life is abundant in this forest, and you're seeing that. On both sides.
explore_forest.story_7: 80% Forest explored:⮀ You've managed to figure out where most of the herds in this forest are during your trip through, you've also stumbled across a fair amount of plants that produce mana, you wonder if they have a use.
explore_forest.story_8: 100% Forest explored:⮀ You've done it, you find it impossible to get lost in the forest now, and your sense of wanderlust has faded. You've seen practically all you can in this forest. There were areas barred to you, and you found no way to enter them with a cursory examination.

wild_mana.label: Wild Mana
wild_mana.tooltip:
They're out of sight of most travellers, but you have time to find and harvest them.
Every good mana spot has
wild_mana.tooltip2:
mana.
Every 10 mana spots have good mana.
wild_mana.story_1: Source checked for mana:⮀ It's just sitting there, stray slightly from the beaten path and you find an abundance of mana just waiting for someone to take it, the only catch being you need to extract it from the plants surrounding it and they've proven slightly unwilling to part with it.
wild_mana.story_2: 50 Sources checked for mana in a loop:⮀ After exploring the forest 100%, you know the path to get all the mana sources, mana mania!
wild_mana.story_3: 100 Sources checked for mana in a loop:⮀ After exploring the thicket 100%, you know the path of the forest and the thicket to get tons of mana, insane!
wild_mana.story_4: 150 Sources checked for mana in a loop:⮀ In the nooks of the forest there is a secret path that you never even noticed, you probly wanted to see the hermit so much. There is 50 more mana sources with your name on it, god speed.

gather_herbs.label: Gather Herbs
gather_herbs.tooltip:
Might as well dig up anything useful you find.
Every 10 funny plants are herbs.
Unlocked at 10% Forest Explored.
gather_herbs.story_1: Plant checked for use:⮀ You pull up random plants across the forest that emanate mana only to find that in most cases, they're simply plants that have started gathering mana, but in some cases they're actually magical plants. Small distinction, but a significant one.

hunt.label: Hunt
hunt.tooltip:
The forest provides.
Every 10 animals have good hides.
Unlocked at 40% Forest Explored.
hunt.story_1: Animal checked for hide:⮀ You manage to track down a relatively harmless animal, but in the time it took you to bring the critter down you had ruined its pelt beyond all use. You needed practice.
hunt.story_2: 10 Animals with hide:⮀ You ghost through the forest, targeting packs that you know graze or are moving through locations easily reached and ambushed. You're starting to get good at this tracking thing, but you suppose you only really have to do it once.
hunt.story_3: 20 Animals with hide:⮀ A deer languishes by the water, lapping gently at the water seemingly unaware of your presence. It remains unaware of your presence as you slowly edge closer, the deer remains unaware of your presence until it is unaware of everything forevermore. You ghost through the forest on silent feet, swift as the wind and as deadly as a viper, your body swaying as you slip between blind spots and perception to reach your targets. The animals feel nothing as they die, you've had much practice. You offer a silent thanks as their pelts will be of value to you.

sit_by_waterfall.label: Sit By Waterfall
sit_by_waterfall.tooltip:
It's peaceful here. Loud, but peaceful.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
Unlocked at 70% Forest Explored.
sit_by_waterfall.story_1: Sat by waterfall:⮀ You find a waterfall flowing from a higher point in a mountain down the side oddly scenic and decide stop to stare for awhile, simply to observe the natural beauty of the sight. As you watched, the force of the water managed to dislodge a small pebble from the top of the waterfall and send it careening down. You watch oddly mesmerized at it bounces along the path, constantly being immersed and spat out by the water. You don't know when you sat down and began meditating, only that you woke from your deep realization hours later.
sit_by_waterfall.story_2: 100 Soul Talent:⮀ You find more at piece with yourself and your body, which makes you a different person all together.
sit_by_waterfall.story_3: 1,000 Soul Talent:⮀ You are learning how to improve yourself past the point anyone has attempted. You can feel your blood going thru your whole body, feels weird.
sit_by_waterfall.story_4: 10,000 Soul Talent:⮀ You have so much soul that the king of soul acknowledges you, having so much soul means your body can be controlled in every part of your body at will.
sit_by_waterfall.story_5: 100,000 Soul Talent:⮀ At this point there is so much soul that you have reached heaven levels, you have trancended and you should feel good about that!

old_shortcut.label: Old Shortcut
old_shortcut.tooltip:
No one has come down this way in quite some time.
Gives some additional herbs.
Old men are a pain unless you know something they care about. Talk to Hermit gives 1% more Hermit Knowledge Learned per 1% Shortcut Explored.
Unlocked at 20% Forest Explored.
old_shortcut.story_1: 1% Shortcut explored:⮀ You continued on with your trip and discovered a small and worn path leading off the main thoroughfare. You wondered what it was and decided to explore.
old_shortcut.story_2: 10% Shortcut explored:⮀ You're mildly surprised to discover a seemingly sprawling network of interconnected paths that seem to get almost everywhere within the forest.
old_shortcut.story_3: 20% Shortcut explored:⮀ You stumble across a small clearing in the forest, racks of drying herbs and bubbling cauldrons litter the clearing. As soon as you step in, a hermit leaps from his hut yelling at you.
old_shortcut.story_4: 40% Shortcut explored:⮀ You continue to explore the shortcuts, you're able to recognize where you are in the sprawling network with a glance. You're able to move freely around the forest.
old_shortcut.story_5: 60% Shortcut explored:⮀ You've discovered another set of hidden shortcuts on the gloomy side of the forest, and set about exploring them, they seem less looked after than those on the other side, but are still serviceable.
old_shortcut.story_6: 80% Shortcut explored:⮀ These old shortcuts are incredible, they almost seem to tell a story of when this forest was more habitable. You wonder why they were forgotten.
old_shortcut.story_7: 100% Shortcut explored:⮀ You dust your hands and smile contently, you've done it. You've traveled every single path to completion. You could start at a completely random point and find your way out. That old hermit seems to like these paths.

talk_to_hermit.label: Talk To Hermit
talk_to_hermit.tooltip:
This old man is happy to have a listening ear, surely he has some useful knowledge. You hope. He's initially confrontational, but opens up once you start talking about the road.
Reduces mana cost of Gather Herbs, Practical Magic, and Learn Alchemy by 0.5% per 1% of Hermit Knowledge.
Unlocked with both 20% Shortcut Explored and 40 Magic.
talk_to_hermit.story_1: 1% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ The Hermit is old, scraggly and surprisingly, not bald. Looks old as dirt. He doesn't know the name of the surrounding provinces, but knows the names of the provinces before the current ones.
talk_to_hermit.story_2: 10% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ The old hermit is an absolute genius at using magic to speed things up and just in general make things quicker and easier. You have much information to wring from him. He doesn't tell you his name and insists you call him 'Old man', or 'Hermit'.
talk_to_hermit.story_3: 20% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ He still hasn't told you his name and you've tried to worm it out of him over multiple loops. He just seems amused at your attempts. Either way, you're steadily wringing out more information from him.
talk_to_hermit.story_4: 40% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ Apparently, the old man was here before this forest was a forest. He remembers the first seeds being sown. Just, what? How old would that even make him?
talk_to_hermit.story_5: 60% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ You learn more about his tells, when to push and when not to. You've angered him and seen him joyful, made him laugh and cry. Reminisce on old memories and curse bitterly. You've almost figured him out. You still don't know his name.
talk_to_hermit.story_6: 80% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ You've spent more time learning about this one man than you have most other things, you've come to see him almost as a familiar figure. With how much time you've spent with him, it's hard not to. You still don't know his name. One thing you do know is that he's been around a long time and has forgotten more about magic than you've learned.
talk_to_hermit.story_7: 100% Hermit knowledge learned:⮀ He finally told you his name. Gelt. He seemed almost knowing as he told you.

practical_magic.label: Practical Magic
practical_magic.tooltip:
Such simple uses to help out with everyday tasks. Genius, really. It's like pulling teeth getting this knowledge from the Hermit though.
Unlocked with both 20% Hermit Knowledge and 50 Magic.
practical_magic.story_1: 1 Practical magic:⮀ You pester the hermit about magic and how to use it to make things easier on yourself. It's surprisingly handy to be able to move things around without havin to be there, rather than smashing pots you can instead lift them or knock them off edges. Why open a lock when you can unlock a latch with Mage Hand, why walk over to the wardrobe if you can just fling it open and ransack it? Magic, but practical. You're a little astonished that not everyone does this.
practical_magic.story_2: 100 Practical magic:⮀ Slowly, slowly, you're starting to become competent at the Hermit's special brand of magic - and it's really convenient. Just the other loop, he taught you a trick to find the value of a pile of coins with a small gesture and a single word!
practical_magic.story_3: 400 Practical magic:⮀ You barely have to pay attention to your magic anymore. Doors open before you reach them, blood and grime vanishes at a thought, and anything you reach for jumps straight into your hands. Life has never been so easy.

learn_alchemy.label: Learn Alchemy
learn_alchemy.tooltip:
You can listen to him yammer while making light healing and remedy potions.
You're starting to think the potion that caused you to loop time was a complex one.
You provide the ingredients; costs 10 herbs.
Gives alchemy and magic skill.
Unlocked with both 40% Hermit Knowledge and 60 Magic.
learn_alchemy.story_1: Alchemy learned:⮀ You ask the hermit about potions and are regaled of tales from his time as an apprentice, the mistakes he made and how one time, he managed to douse his masters beard with potion that would wildly change the color of it every minute, for a full year his master had to deal with a beard that was either glowing white like pure fallen snow or was more fit to be in the sky after rain. You take notes as the hermit speaks.
learn_alchemy.story_2: 25 Alchemy:⮀ You sit by the fire inside the hermits clearing, fire dancing merrily away as he feeds magical herbs to the fire while throwing precise amounts into the large pot boiling above it. The stories he tells of his youth and learning alchemy under his master make you howl with laughter and provoke deep thoughtful silences.
learn_alchemy.story_3: 100 Alchemy:⮀ As you learn more and more about alchemy, the potion that caused you to start looping begins to seem more and more hideously complex. Something as simple as your reputation can effect the outcome of a potion. It's more of an art than a science, or anything even easily conveyed really.
learn_alchemy.story_4: 500 Alchemy:⮀ Alchemy helps more and more with the potion trader that you now can get tons of gold from him in the next town, you wonder how much it will take to bankrupt them.

brew_potions.label: Brew Potions
brew_potions.tooltip:
Bubbles and Flasks. Potions and Magic.
Requires a reputation of 5 or above, or he won't let you near his stuff.
Creates a potion from 10 herbs to sell at the next town.
Gives alchemy and magic skill.
Unlocked with 10 Alchemy.
brew_potions.story_1: Potion brewed:⮀ The old man happily lets you use his apparatus to brew your own potions after much haranguing about your technique and the fact that you're not buying ingredients off him, he leaves you to it. His workstations are old, well used and obviously well looked after. The only fault you can lay at their feet is that the measuring system used is older than dirt. Fits you suppose.
brew_potions.story_2: Action failed with low reputation:⮀ The hermit refuses to allow you near his workstations and potion brewing equipment no matter how much you ask and offer to pay. He tells you that you don't have a good enough karma for him to even be willing to risk you using his workstations and potion benches.
brew_potions.story_3: Action failed with negative reputation:⮀ The hermit shoos you away from his clearing when you even make a mention of using his potion supplies, something about not wanting you to taint his equipment with your karma.

train_dexterity.label: Train Dexterity
train_dexterity.tooltip:
There's a nice array of rocks to hop between. It's a lot of fun.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
Unlocked at 60% Forest Explored.
train_dexterity.story_1: Dexterity trained:⮀ You find rocks spaced intermittently in an open clearing. Your best guess is that they were set up as a training field for some mercenary group that had passed by. Either way, it's fun to bounce from one rock to another parrying invisible enemies and fighting the air.

train_speed.label: Train Speed
train_speed.tooltip:
A forest run is fantastic. You feel like you're learning a lot as you push your limits.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
Unlocked at 80% Forest Explored.
train_speed.story_1: Speed trained:⮀ Sprinting through the forest is an exhilarating experience. The vines whip past your head, the roots beneath your feet. The leaves whip past your face and the breeze blows hard enough against your ears that you hear nothing but. You feel at one with the forest as you chase a finch around, up and down and even under trees at times. Through dilapidated trunks and wooden labyrinths.

follow_flowers.label: Follow Flowers
follow_flowers.tooltip:
You've located an oddly out of place trail of flowers, why not see where it leads. You can find more herbs along the path.
2x progress with glasses.
Unlocked at 50% Forest Explored.
follow_flowers.story_1: 1% Flower trail followed:⮀ You stumble across a small lane of flowers that are obviously planted by hand. You decide to follow it.
follow_flowers.story_2: 10% Flower trail followed:⮀ The planted flowers seem almost sprawling, threading to and fro across the forest.
follow_flowers.story_3: 20% Flower trail followed:⮀ The flowers led you to places in the forest that you hadn't been, you discovered a thicket that was overflowing with mana, but you would need to experiment to figure out how to draw the mana out.
follow_flowers.story_4: 40% Flower trail followed:⮀ The flowers continued to follow their unseen path, but you were starting to notice a pattern.
follow_flowers.story_5: 60% Flower trail followed:⮀ There were strange plants aplenty to be found along the flower path, and you had noticed that some had medicinal properties, you remembered from when you were young, the smell unmistakable.
follow_flowers.story_6: 80% Flower trail followed:⮀ The flower path was circuitous, circling around the darker side of the forest in patterns that you were starting to map out mentally.
follow_flowers.story_7: 100% Flower trail followed:⮀ The patterns were strangely geometric, and you had an inkling that the flower path had some sinister beginnings. Regardless, you'd explored the entire path. You were right too, it never did stray from the darker side of the forest.

bird_watching.label: Bird Watching
bird_watching.tooltip:
Far along the flower trail, there seems to be a large variety of birds flying about. Perhaps you could take up a new hobby.
Requires glasses.
Has 4x exp/talent gain, and can only be done
times per reset.
Unlocked at 80% Flower Trail Followed.
bird_watching.story_1: Birds watched:⮀ You spot a colorful bird and attempt to follow it with your eyes, you fail. You try again and again until you can reliable pick out fast moving birds and animals with pinpoint precision. It's also strangely relaxing to watch birds congregate together, listening to the bird-call and watching them interact. Its fast, frenetic and savage at times, but that's nature.

clear_thicket.label: Clear Thicket
clear_thicket.tooltip:
The path of flowers has lead you to a thicket, seemingly in the middle of nowhere. Perhaps it's some strange magic. You can clear out the thicket to find some more wild mana.
Unlocked at 20% Flower Trail Followed.
clear_thicket.story_1: 1% Thicket explored:⮀ You trek to a thicket you found while following the flower path and decide to explore it. Maybe you'll find some more mana. It's not like it belongs to anyone.
clear_thicket.story_2: 10% Thicket explored:⮀ You've found more of these secluded thickets off the flower path than you thought you would, and you have a sense that there are many more that you haven't found yet.
clear_thicket.story_3: 20% Thicket explored:⮀ The mana in these thickets is rich and helpful, extending your time in the loop to let you search for more and more. The break from people is a nice break from normal too.
clear_thicket.story_4: 40% Thicket explored:⮀ You've thoroughly explored the darker side of the forest, and while resting close to the path that cut the forest in half, you stumbled across another thicket in the lighter side of the forest.
clear_thicket.story_5: 60% Thicket explored:⮀ You continued to stroll around to all the thickets you had found. They were innumerable at this point, just endless tangled tiny clearings and glades.
clear_thicket.story_6: 80% Thicket explored:⮀ Surely by now you're getting close to finding them all? Every time you think you're getting close you find another section of the forest that had clearings. How did you not find these earlier?
clear_thicket.story_7: 100% Thicket explored:⮀ You stumbled across another thicket and throw your hands up. You would question how you missed all these extra thickets but you don't really care at this point. You've gotten disturbingly good at ripping nature to pieces in search of more mana.

talk_to_witch.label: Talk To Witch
talk_to_witch.tooltip:
Talk to the witch to learn her secrets of the dark arts.
Unlocked with both 60% Thicket Explored and 80 Magic.
Reduces mana cost of Dark Magic and Dark Ritual by 0.5% per 1% of Witch Knowledge.
talk_to_witch.story_1: 1% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You stumble across a small crooked hut and as you approach the boundary, a small slip of a woman step outs. She's stunning and you're immediately on guard. The area pulses with a heady hum of magic that sends shivers down your spine. She introduces herself as Evis.
talk_to_witch.story_2: 10% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ The Witch as you taken to referring to her as, seeing as she changes her name every time she introduces herself to you, is a veritable font of magical knowledge, of how to dominate the mana itself and make more from less.
talk_to_witch.story_3: 20% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You continue to hunt down the Witch and drag more information out of her, the magic she teaches you is cruel, callous even. The witch is surprisingly personable for what you would consider a stereotypical 'Wicked Witch'.
talk_to_witch.story_4: 40% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You start to learn more about the witches daily routine as you spend more and more time around her, the relationship you manage to cultivate with her at the start of each loop grows more familiar with each repetition. She seems to be slightly more interested each time you reveal your knowledge of dark magic.
talk_to_witch.story_5: 50% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ You had apparently impressed her enough this time that she took you to a clearing she had found, and explained to you a ritual that would give you a boost, permanently through any circumstances by calling upon the dark gods. The catch she explained, with ill concealed glee, was that you would need souls to sacrifice if you wanted to do this ritual.
talk_to_witch.story_6: 60% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ As you learn more and more about the witch and her varied names, one thing starts to become glaringly obvious. The Witch and The Hermit know one another. If her irritable grumbling about the old fool and his idiotic desires were anything to go by. You get the feeling that their relationship is complex.
talk_to_witch.story_7: 80% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ The witch is struck with a strange sense of melancholy one loop and you have no idea why, but the witch is strangely open with information and you manage to pry out more of the relationship between her and the Hermit. They were lovers once, and to your surprise, she used to be the one whom nature adores. She shuts up quickly after letting that slip. You're all the more determined to pry it out of her though.
talk_to_witch.story_8: 100% Witch knowledge learned:⮀ Somehow she seems to sense something about you this loop, and she tells you her name, and its the name she gives for every loop after. Trisha. You manage to pry most of her relationship with the hermit from her. They were lovers once, this you knew, but what you didn't was that she was of nobility and he a common vagabond. She fell for him and him for her, it was a love for the ages she tells you while drunk from the wine you brought along with you. He wanted to run away with her and she agreed, too love struck to question why. He was running from deals he had made and bargains he had forsaken, his glib tounge landing him in trouble of the otherworldly nature. Trisha seems frustrated with her youth's naivety as she tells you how she was made a scapegoat for his failings and forfeits in his deals and bargains. How she was essentially sold to the dark gods as his forfeit. When you ask what she did in return, all Trisha does is smile with dark satisfaction, the fire flaring briefly.

dark_magic.label: Dark Magic
dark_magic.tooltip:
Embrace the dark arts to more efficiently harvest mana. But at what cost?
Adds 1 negative reputation.
Requires a reputation of 0 or below.
Unlocked with both 20% Witch Knowledge and 100 Magic.
dark_magic.story_1: 1 Dark magic:⮀ You ask the witch for more information on dark magic and then during the conversation slowly reveal your interest in the subject and float the offer that you would be willing to trade if she would teach you the beginning steps. She smirks deviously and agrees to the deal.
dark_magic.story_2: 25 Dark magic:⮀ The witch demands more and more of you and you slowly figure out ways of broaching the subject with her that doesn't startle her enough that she stops talking to you or just flat out shuts you down. The magic she begins to teach is brutal, ominous and forceful. You do not work with or help, you take and dominate.
dark_magic.story_3: 50 Dark magic:⮀ The dark magic she teaches seems to veer more to the side of ritualistic sacrifice and communion with the dark gods, she tells you when you ask that its because she can't really teach you too much more unless you have a darker being backing you as her mana isn't inherent but a gift from the darker divine powers. She teaches you of a ritual that you can use to summon the dark gods and strike a bargain. She warns that you'll need souls as payment.
dark_magic.story_4: 300 Dark magic:⮀ As you become more skilled at dark magic, the number of applications for it continues to grow. Now you're learning to damage fundamental aspects of the universe, although you can only do it in places where the fabric of the universe is already weak. Also, doing anything useful with the damage is much harder - you might have to bring in another field of magic for that.

dark_ritual.label: Dark Ritual
dark_ritual.tooltip:
Sacrifice an increasing amount of soulstones to the dark gods, granting a permanent speed 10% boost to all actions in Beginnersville.
Gives (dark magic skill) * (1 + witch knowledge / 100) * (1 + main stat / 100) * (original mana cost / actual mana cost) progress points per mana.
Requires a reputation of -5 or below.
Can only have 1 Dark Ritual action.
Unlocked with both 50% Witch Knowledge and 50 Dark Magic.
Sacrifices (50 * (rituals completed+1)) soulstones. Currently sacrificing
dark_ritual.story_1: 3rd ritual segment reached:⮀ Knowing what the ritual was and how large a space you would need, you were mildly surprised to find a clearing large enough in the forest. Well, the clearing itself wasn't really large enough on its own. It was a dense cluster of clearings that you've taken mana from that you could easily clear out to make a ritual space. Preparing the altar is surprisingly tame, all said and done. Stone and wood comprise most of the altar and the rest you brought with you when you made this plan. In the end the altar you build is only small, a communion point instead of a summoning. Holding a heart from nearby deer, you pierce it and begin to chant ritualistic words of power. The clearing grows dark and the forest quietens, nary a sound is heard apart from the drip drip drip of the blood from the pierced heart in your hand. The blood you've spilled on the altar begins to blacken and swirl without outside force and eventually forms into a small face, disgusting to look at but enough to communicate through.
dark_ritual.story_2: Ritual completed:⮀ You commune with the dark gods long past the point that the blood has faded. The deal is struck thusly: time itself will move faster for you only in select areas, and you will pay a cost in souls. The dark god you commune with seems almost surprised as you immediately offer up some of the soulstones that you have.
dark_ritual.story_3: 50 Rituals completed:⮀ The more rituals you perform, the more extravagant setups the dark gods demand, and the less they reward you with. Towers of soulstones swirl away into dust as you get up and stretch. You'd think they'd be pleased to have a repeat customer.
